ACG.word_requests¶

ACG.word_requests.urls_and_parsers¶

This module provides different parsers (children of Parser) to obtain the necessary words to fill the Anki-cards.

Each parser returns a dict, that can directly be used by the pt_word.Word.update_from_dict() method of the pt_word.Word class.

parsers.DEFAULT_HEADERS[source]¶

Default headers for the Parser class.

Bases: parsers.Parser

Uses Dicio to obtain: explanations, synonyms, antonyms, examples, add_info_dict, conj_table_html

class parsers.Parser[source]¶

Base class for parsers.

Main functionality is the result_dict function.

base_url = [source]¶

URL to make request to. Can contain every class attribute. E.g. https://some.url/{phrase}/dest={from_lang};src={to_lang}.html

from_lang[source]¶

Target language.

headers[source]¶

Headers for the request. Defaults to DEFAULT_HEADERS.

make_request(self, url=None)[source]¶

Uses headers to make an http-request via get()

Returns

Response object

ACG.word_requests.words¶

Implementation of Word.

class words.Word[source]¶

Class that fetches and edits the words that makes up the choices, presented to the user in the card-generation process.

Main function is search() function.

add_info_dict[source]¶
add_translations(self)[source]¶

For the attributes [“examples”, “synonyms”, “antonyms”], it iterates to the corresponding lists and adds translations, where none are already present.

Parameters

save_as_json(self, path=None)[source]¶

Saves class attributes as dictionary in a .json-file.

Parameters

path – If None, is set to f”words/{self.folder()}/{self.folder()}.json” (Default value = None)

search(self, new_search_term)[source]¶

If possible loads from previously saved search. If not, uses the parsers to obtain info and adds translations, then saves the result for future searches.

Parameters

new_search_term –

translations = [][source]¶
update_from_dict(self, attr_dict)[source]¶

Iterates through attr_dict and updates Word attributes.

If the value is a list, it extends the original list, else the value is set to the value of attr_dict

Parameters

attr_dict – Each key should be the name of an attribute of Word, the value corresponds to the updated value.
